questions.content: Which is a benefit of a wetland area in an ecosystem?
questions.answer: Wetlands store and slowly release surface water, rain, groundwater, and flood waters.
candidates: Wetlands store and slowly release surface water, rain, groundwater, and flood waters.
Vegetation and soil in wetlands add more nitrogen and phosphorus to water.
Wetlands cause more pollutants and excess nutrients in water.
Wetlands increase environmental problems such as algal blooms.

questions.content: A group of chemicals that were formerly used in manufacturing of products known as “PCBs” persist in the environment.  What does “PCBs” stand for?
